conclusion: Understanding the relationship between light source position, objects, and resulting shadows is necessary.
Initial setup: light source closer to objects, creating larger and elongated shadows.
Shadow A: Dark elongated shadow of cylindrical object.
Shadow B: Elongated shadow cast by the sphere.
Shadow C: Shadow resembling a silhouette of a hand holding a cup.
Shadow D: Rectangular shadow of brick-like object with visible grid patterns.
Moving light source backward changes angle of light rays, affecting shadow size and position.
Shadows shift closer to objects as light source moves backward.
Shadow A moves closer to cylindrical object.
Shadow B moves closer to sphere.
Shadow C moves closer to hand-cup object.
Shadow D moves closer to brick-like object.
Shadows become smaller as light source moves farther away.
Shadow C becomes smaller and less elongated.
Shadow D becomes smaller but retains rectangular shape with reduced grid pattern visibility.
Verification with second image shows shadows becoming smaller and moving closer to objects.
Final answer: Shadows move closer to objects and become smaller in size.
